intro: Vulpia antofagastensis, commonly known as the Antofagasta hairgrass, is a small annual grass species native to South America, particularly Chile. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
